errors.error_description: The supported Python versions are incorrectly stated as 'Python 3.6 or higher', which is too broad and may lead to installation on unsupported older Python versions.
correction_candidates: To install Pastas, a working version of Python 3.9, 3.10, 3.11, or 3.12 has to be installed on your computer.
To install Pastas, any version of Python 3 will work.
To install Pastas, you must use Python 3.11.
To install Pastas, a working version of Python 3.9 or newer has to be installed on your computer.
errors.golden_answer: To install Pastas, a working version of Python 3.9, 3.10, 3.11, or 3.12 has to be installed on your computer.

errors.error_description: The command to install the development version from git is syntactically incorrect. `pip install --git` is not a valid pip command.
correction_candidates: pip install git+https://github.com/pastas/pastas.git@dev
pip install git+https://github.com/pastas/pastas.git@dev#egg=pastas
pip install pastas --pre
git clone https://github.com/pastas/pastas.git && cd pastas && pip install -e .

errors.error_description: The command `pip install pastas[all]` is incorrect for installing optional dependencies. The correct extra identifier is `full`, not `all`.
correction_candidates: pip install pastas --with-extras
pip install pastas[full]
pip install pastas lmfit latexify
pip install pastas --all-dependencies

errors.error_description: The installation instructions for the stable version incorrectly place the `pip install pastas` command before the creation and activation of the virtual environment, which will install the package in the global environment instead of the isolated one.
correction_candidates: Move the `pip install pastas` command to be after the `source pastas-env/bin/activate` command.
Replace `python -m venv pastas-env` with `conda create -n pastas-env python=3.10`.
The order is correct, but the command should be `pip install pastas -e .`.
Remove the virtual environment instructions as they are not necessary with Anaconda.
errors.golden_answer: Move the `pip install pastas` command to be after the `source pastas-env/bin/activate` command.

errors.error_description: Changed pip install command to conda install for stable version installation, creating inconsistency with update command
correction_candidates: pip install pastas
conda install -c conda-forge pastas
python -m pip install pastas
pip3 install pastas

errors.error_description: Downgraded dependency versions to older incompatible versions that conflict with current Python requirements
correction_candidates: Update to numpy>=1.7, matplotlib>=3.1, pandas>=1.1, scipy>=1.8, numba>=0.51
Update to numpy>=1.20, matplotlib>=3.5, pandas>=1.3, scipy>=1.7, numba>=0.56
Update to numpy>=1.18, matplotlib>=3.2, pandas>=1.2, scipy>=1.6, numba>=0.53
Update to numpy>=1.19, matplotlib>=3.3, pandas>=1.0, scipy>=1.5, numba>=0.50
errors.golden_answer: Update to numpy>=1.7, matplotlib>=3.1, pandas>=1.1, scipy>=1.8, numba>=0.51
